data.title: Elections: South Korean National Assembly 2024 General
data.text:
At Stake in this Election:

All 300 seats in the National Assembly of the Republic of Korea

Government Structure:

Chief of State and Head of Government: President YOON Suk Yeol (since 10 May 2022)

Assembly: unicameral National Assembly (Gukhoe / 大韓民國國會)

Electoral System:

The President is directly elected by a simple majority popular vote for a single 5-year term.

253 members of the National Assembly are directly elected in single-seat constituencies by simple majority vote. The remaining 47 members are elected in a single national constituency. All members serve 4-year terms.

Last Election:

The last parliamentary elections were held on April 15, 2020. The Democratic Party won 180 seats, the United Future Party won 103, and the Justice Party won 1 seat. Voter turnout was 66%.

Information for Voters:

“Voting” from the National Election Commission of the Republic of Korea (available in English)

Main Parties in this Election:

Democratic Party of Korea** / 더불어민주당[ (DPK)

Leader: Lee Jae-myung

Seats won in the last election: 156 seats out of 300

In 2022, the parties Open Democratic Party / 열린민주당 and New Wave / 새로운물결 joined the DPK

People Power Party /국민의힘 (PPP)

Leader: Han Dong-hoon

Seats won in the last election: 114 seats out of 300

Green-Justice Party / 정의당 (JP)

Leader: Kim Jun-woo

Seats won in the last election: 6 seats out of 300

New Future Party / 새로운미래

Leader: Lee JNak-yon

Seats won in the last election: 5 seats out of 300

Population:

Population: 51,628,117 (2022)

Gender Data:

Female Population: 25,854,360 (2022)

CEDAW Status: Signed 25 May 1983, Ratified 27 December 1984

Gender Quota: Yes, South Korea has legislated gender quotas for parliament and at the sub-national level. Political parties have also adopted voluntary gender quotas.

Female Candidates in this election: Yes

Number of Female Legislators (pre-election): 57 out of 299

Human Development Index (HDI) Position: 0.929 (Very high) (2024 estimate)

Social Institutions and Gender Index (SIGI) Categorization: 19.8% (2024 estimate)

Disability Data:

CRPD Status: Signed 30 March 2007, Ratified 11 December 2008

Projected population with a disability: 8,260,498

IFES Resources:
